trans-unit.source: Arguably the most common use and misuse of user agent sniffing is to detect if the device is a mobile device. However, people too often overlook what they are really after. People use user agent sniffing to detect if the users' device is touch-friendly and has a small screen so they can optimize their website accordingly. While user agent sniffing can sometimes detect these, not all devices are the same: some mobile devices have big screen sizes, some desktops have a small touchscreen, some people use smart TV's which are an entirely different ballgame altogether, and some people can dynamically change the width and height of their screen by flipping their tablet on its side! So, user agent sniffing is definitely not the way to go. Thankfully, there are much better alternatives. Use Navigator.maxTouchPoints to detect if the user's device has a touchscreen. Then, default back to checking the user agent screen only if (!("maxTouchPoints" in navigator)) { /*Code here*/}. Using this information of whether the device has a touchscreen, do not change the entire layout of the website just for touch devices: you will only create more work and maintenance for yourself. Rather, add in touch conveniences such as bigger, more easily clickable buttons (you can do this using CSS by simply increasing the font size). Here is an example of code that increases the padding of #exampleButton to 1em on mobile devices.
trans-unit.target: 可以说，用户代理嗅探的最常见使用和误用是检测设备是否为移动设备。但是，人们常常忽略了他们的真正追求。人们使用用户代理嗅探功能来检测用户的设备是否触摸友好且屏幕较小，以便他们可以相应地优化其网站。尽管用户代理嗅探有时可以检测到这些，但并非所有设备都是相同的：某些移动设备的屏幕尺寸较大，某些台式机的触摸屏较小，有些人使用的智能电视完全不同，而有些人可以动态更改翻转平板电脑侧面的屏幕宽度和高度！因此，用户代理嗅探绝对不是要走的路。值得庆幸的是，还有更好的选择。使用Navigator.maxTouchPoints检测用户设备是否具有触摸屏。然后，仅在（！（导航器中的“ maxTouchPoints”））{/ *此处代码* /}时，才默认返回到检查用户代理屏幕。使用有关设备是否具有触摸屏的信息，不要只为触摸设备更改网站的整个布局：您只会自己做更多的工作和维护。而是添加触摸式便利，例如更大，更容易单击的按钮（您可以通过简单地增加字体大小来使用CSS来实现此目的）。这是在移动设备上将#exampleButton的填充增加到1em的代码示例。

trans-unit.source: Arguably the most common use and misuse of user agent sniffing is to detect if the device is a mobile device. However, what is failed to be accountable is what they're really after. People use user agent sniffing to detect if the users' device is touch-friendly and has a small screen so they can optimize their website accordingly. While user agent sniffing can sometimes detect these, not all devices are the same. Some mobile devices have big screen sizes, some desktops have a small touchscreen, some people use smart TV's which are an entirely different ballgame altogether, some people can dynamically change the width and height of their screen by flipping their tablet on its side! So, user agent sniffing is definitely not the way to go. But, there are much better alternatives. Use Navigator.maxTouchPoints to detect if the user's device has a touchscreen. Then, default back to checking the user agent screen only if (!("maxTouchPoints" in Navigator)) { /*Code here*/}. Using this information of whether the device has a touchscreen, do not change the entire layout of the website just for touch devices: you will only create more work and maintenance for yourself. Rather, add in touch conveniences such as bigger, more easily clickable buttons (you can do this using CSS by simply increasing the font size). As for the screen size, simply use window.innerWidth and window.addEventListener("resize", function(){ /*refresh screen size dependent things*/ }). What you want to do for screen size is not slash off information on smaller screens. That will only annoy people because it will force them to use the desktop version. Rather, try to have fewer columns of information in a longer page on smaller screens while having more columns with a shorter page on larger screen sizes. This effect can be easily achieved using CSS flexboxes. Next, always make your code dynamic. The user can flip their mobile device on its side, changing the width and height of the page. Never be satisfied with your webpage until you can open up the dev tools side panel and resize the screen while the webpage looks smooth, fluid, and dynamically resized.
trans-unit.target: 可以说，用户代理嗅探的最常见使用和误用是检测设备是否为移动设备。但是，无法追究的是他们真正追求的。人们使用用户代理嗅探功能来检测用户的设备是否触摸友好且屏幕较小，因此可以相应地优化其网站。尽管用户代理嗅探有时可以检测到这些，但并非所有设备都是相同的。一些移动设备的屏幕尺寸很大，一些台式机的触摸屏很小，有些人使用的智能电视完全不同，有些人可以通过翻转平板电脑的侧面来动态改变屏幕的宽度和高度！因此，用户代理嗅探绝对不是要走的路。但是，还有更好的选择。使用Navigator.maxTouchPoints以检测用户的设备是否具有触摸屏。然后，默认情况下仅在（！（导航器中的“ maxTouchPoints”））{/ *此处代码* /}时才返回检查用户代理屏幕。使用有关设备是否具有触摸屏的信息，不要仅为触摸设备更改网站的整个布局：您只会自己做更多的工作和维护。而是添加触摸式便利，例如更大，更容易单击的按钮（您可以通过简单地增加字体大小来使用CSS来实现）。至于屏幕大小，只需使用window.innerWidth和window.addEventListener（“ resize”，function（）{/ *刷新屏幕大小相关的东西* /}）。您想要的屏幕尺寸并不是在较小的屏幕上削减信息。这只会使人们感到烦恼，因为它将迫使他们使用桌面版本。而是，在较大的屏幕上，尝试在较长的页面上使较少的信息列在较长的页面上，而在较大的屏幕上，尝试使具有较少的信息的列在较短的页面上。使用CSS flexboxes可以轻松实现这种效果。接下来，始终使代码动态化。用户可以将其移动设备侧翻，以更改页面的宽度和高度。除非您可以打开开发工具侧面板并调整屏幕大小，然后网页看上去平滑，流畅且可以动态调整大小，否则请不要对您的网页感到满意。

trans-unit.source:
Argument syntax:
#field-name
The "no-cache" response directive indicates that the response MUST NOT be used to satisfy a subsequent request without successful validation on the origin server. This allows an origin server to prevent a cache from using it to satisfy a request without contacting it, even by caches that have been configured to send stale responses.
If the no-cache response directive specifies one or more field-names, then a cache MAY use the response to satisfy a subsequent request, subject to any other restrictions on caching. However, any header fields in the response that have the field-name(s) listed MUST NOT be sent in the response to a subsequent request without successful revalidation with the origin server. This allows an origin server to prevent the re-use of certain header fields in a response, while still allowing caching of the rest of the response.
The field-names given are not limited to the set of header fields defined by this specification. Field names are case-insensitive.
This directive uses the quoted-string form of the argument syntax. A sender SHOULD NOT generate the token form (even if quoting appears not to be needed for single-entry lists).
Note: Although it has been back-ported to many implementations, some HTTP/1.0 caches will not recognize or obey this directive. Also, no-cache response directives with field-names are often handled by caches as if an unqualified no-cache directive was received; i.e., the special handling for the qualified form is not widely implemented.
trans-unit.target: 参数语法。#"no-cache "响应指令表示在没有在源服务器上成功验证的情况下,该响应决不能被用于满足后续的请求,这允许源服务器防止缓存在没有联系的情况下使用它来满足请求。这允许源服务器防止缓存在没有联系它的情况下使用它来满足请求,甚至是被配置成发送陈旧响应的缓存。如果no-cache响应指令指定了一个或多个字段名,那么缓存可以使用响应来满足后续的请求,但要受到任何其他的缓存限制。然而,响应中的任何头字段,如果没有经过源服务器的成功重新验证,就不能在响应后续请求时发送。这允许源服务器防止重复使用响应中的某些头字段,同时仍然允许缓存响应的其余部分。给出的字段名不限于本规范定义的头字段集。字段名是不区分大小写的。这条指令使用引号字符串形式的参数语法。发送者不应该生成标记形式(即使单项列表似乎不需要引用)。注意:尽管它已经被回移植到许多实现中,但一些HTTP/1.0缓存将无法识别或服从此指令。另外,带有字段名的无缓存响应指令通常被缓存处理为接收到一个无限定的无缓存指令;也就是说,对限定形式的特殊处理没有得到广泛的实现。

trans-unit.source:
Argument syntax:
#field-name
The "private" response directive indicates that the response message is intended for a single user and MUST NOT be stored by a shared cache. A private cache MAY store the response and reuse it for later requests, even if the response would normally be non-cacheable.
If the private response directive specifies one or more field-names, this requirement is limited to the field-values associated with the listed response header fields. That is, a shared cache MUST NOT store the specified field-names(s), whereas it MAY store the remainder of the response message.
The field-names given are not limited to the set of header fields defined by this specification. Field names are case-insensitive.
This directive uses the quoted-string form of the argument syntax. A sender SHOULD NOT generate the token form (even if quoting appears not to be needed for single-entry lists).
Note: This usage of the word "private" only controls where the response can be stored; it cannot ensure the privacy of the message content. Also, private response directives with field-names are often handled by caches as if an unqualified private directive was received; i.e., the special handling for the qualified form is not widely implemented.
trans-unit.target: 参数语法。#field-name "private "响应指令表示响应消息是为单个用户准备的,决不能由共享缓存存储。私有缓存可以存储响应并在以后的请求中重复使用,即使响应通常是不可缓存的。如果私有响应指令指定了一个或多个字段名,这个要求仅限于与列出的响应头字段相关的字段值。也就是说,共享缓存必须不存储指定的字段名,而可以存储响应消息的其余部分。给出的字段名不限于本规范定义的头字段集。字段名是不区分大小写的。这条指令使用引号字符串形式的参数语法。发送者不应该生成标记形式(即使单项列表似乎不需要引号)。注意:"private "一词的这种用法只控制响应可以存储在哪里,它不能确保消息内容的隐私。另外,带有字段名的私有响应指令通常会被缓存处理,就像收到一个无限定的私有指令一样;也就是说,限定形式的特殊处理并没有被广泛实现。

trans-unit.source: Argument syntax: delta-seconds (see Section 1.2.1) The "max-age" request directive indicates that the client is unwilling to accept a response whose age is greater than the specified number of seconds. Unless the max-stale request directive is also present, the client is not willing to accept a stale response. This directive uses the token form of the argument syntax: e.g., 'max-age=5' not 'max-age="5"'. A sender SHOULD NOT generate the quoted-string form.
trans-unit.target: 参数语法：delta-seconds（请参见1.2.1节）“ max-age”请求指令指示客户端不愿意接受年龄大于指定秒数的响应。除非还存在max-stale request指令，否则客户端将不愿意接受过时的响应。该指令使用参数语法的令牌形式：例如，'max-age = 5'而不是'max-age =“ 5”'。发件人不应生成带引号的字符串形式。

trans-unit.source: Argument syntax: delta-seconds (see Section 1.2.1) The "max-age" response directive indicates that the response is to be considered stale after its age is greater than the specified number of seconds. This directive uses the token form of the argument syntax: e.g., 'max-age=5' not 'max-age="5"'. A sender SHOULD NOT generate the quoted-string form.
trans-unit.target: 参数语法：delta-seconds（请参阅第1.2.1节）“ max-age”响应指令指示响应的使用期限大于指定的秒数后，将被视为过期。该指令使用参数语法的令牌形式：例如，'max-age = 5'而不是'max-age =“ 5”'。发件人不应生成带引号的字符串形式。

trans-unit.source: Argument syntax: delta-seconds (see Section 1.2.1) The "max-stale" request directive indicates that the client is willing to accept a response that has exceeded its freshness lifetime. If max-stale is assigned a value, then the client is willing to accept a response that has exceeded its freshness lifetime by no more than the specified number of seconds. If no value is assigned to max-stale, then the client is willing to accept a stale response of any age. This directive uses the token form of the argument syntax: e.g., 'max-stale=10' not 'max-stale="10"'. A sender SHOULD NOT generate the quoted-string form.
trans-unit.target: 参数语法：delta-seconds（请参见1.2.1节）“ max-stale”请求指令指示客户端愿意接受超过其新鲜度寿命的响应。如果为max-stale分配了一个值，那么客户端将愿意接受一个超过其新鲜度寿命不超过指定秒数的响应。如果没有为max-stale分配任何值，则客户端愿意接受任何年龄的过时响应。该指令使用参数语法的令牌形式：例如，“ max-stale = 10”而不是“ max-stale =“ 10””。发件人不应生成带引号的字符串形式。

trans-unit.source: Argument syntax: delta-seconds (see Section 1.2.1) The "s-maxage" response directive indicates that, in shared caches, the maximum age specified by this directive overrides the maximum age specified by either the max-age directive or the Expires header field. The s-maxage directive also implies the semantics of the proxy-revalidate response directive. This directive uses the token form of the argument syntax: e.g., 's-maxage=10' not 's-maxage="10"'. A sender SHOULD NOT generate the quoted-string form.
trans-unit.target: 参数语法：delta-seconds（请参阅第1.2.1节）“ s-maxage”响应指令指示在共享缓存中，此指令指定的最大期限将覆盖max-age指令或Expires指定的最大期限。标头字段。 s-maxage指令还暗含了proxy-revalidate响应指令的语义。该指令使用参数语法的令牌形式：例如，'s-maxage = 10'而不是's-maxage =“ 10”'。发件人不应生成带引号的字符串形式。

trans-unit.source: Argument syntax: delta-seconds (see Section 1.2.1) The "min-fresh" request directive indicates that the client is willing to accept a response whose freshness lifetime is no less than its current age plus the specified time in seconds. That is, the client wants a response that will still be fresh for at least the specified number of seconds. This directive uses the token form of the argument syntax: e.g., 'min-fresh=20' not 'min-fresh="20"'. A sender SHOULD NOT generate the quoted-string form.
trans-unit.target: 参数语法：delta-seconds（请参阅第1.2.1节）“ min-fresh”请求指令指示客户端愿意接受其新鲜度寿命不小于其当前时间加上指定时间（以秒为单位）的响应。也就是说，客户端希望响应至少在指定的秒数内仍保持新鲜。该指令使用参数语法的令牌形式：例如，'min-fresh = 20'而不是'min-fresh =“ 20”'。发件人不应生成带引号的字符串形式。

trans-unit.source: Articles
trans-unit.target: Articles

trans-unit.source: As a defence-in-depth measure, however, it is possible to use cookie prefixes to assert specific facts about the cookie. Two prefixes are available:
trans-unit.target: 但是，作为深度防御措施，可以使用cookie前缀来断言有关cookie的特定事实。有两个前缀可用：

trans-unit.source: As a header for a multipart body
trans-unit.target: 作为一个多部分主体的标题

trans-unit.source: As a multipart document format, it consists of different parts, delimited by a boundary (a string starting with a double dash '--'). Each part is its own entity with its own HTTP headers, Content-Disposition, and Content-Type for file uploading fields.
trans-unit.target: 作为多部分文档格式，它由不同部分组成，并由边界（以双破折号 '--' 开头的字符串）分隔。每个部分都是其自己的实体，具有自己的HTTP标头， Content-Disposition 和 Content-Type (用于文件上传字段）。

trans-unit.source: As a multipart document format, it consists of different parts, delimited by a boundary (a string starting with a double dash --). Each part is its own entity with its own HTTP headers, Content-Disposition, and Content-Type for file uploading fields.
trans-unit.target: 作为多部分文档格式，它由不同部分组成，并由边界（以双破折号 -- 开头的字符串）分隔。每个部分都是自己的实体，带有自己的HTTP标头， Content-Disposition 和 Content-Type (用于文件上传字段）。

trans-unit.source: As a response header for the main body
trans-unit.target: 作为主体的响应头

trans-unit.source: As above, but use proxy for local servers which are outside the firewall
trans-unit.target: 如上所述,但使用防火墙外的本地服务器的代理。

trans-unit.source: As an HTTP/1.x connection is serializing requests, even without any ordering, it can't be optimal without large enough available bandwidth. As a solution, browsers open several connections to each domain, sending parallel requests. Default was once 2 to 3 connections, but this has now increased to a more common use of 6 parallel connections. There is a risk of triggering DoS protection on the server side if attempting more than this number.
trans-unit.target: 由于HTTP / 1.x连接正在对请求进行序列化，即使没有任何顺序，如果没有足够大的可用带宽也不是最佳选择。作为解决方案，浏览器打开到每个域的多个连接，发送并行请求。默认曾经是2到3个连接，但是现在增加到了6个并行连接的更普遍使用。如果尝试超过此数目，则可能会在服务器端触发DoS保护。

trans-unit.source: As an ultimate form of protection, sites that want to never allow scripts to be executed can opt to globally disallow script execution.
trans-unit.target: 作为一种最终的保护形式,想要永远不允许执行脚本的网站可以选择全局禁止执行脚本。

trans-unit.source: As compression brings significant performance improvements, it is recommended to activate it for all files, but already compressed ones like images, audio files and videos.
trans-unit.target: 由于压缩会带来显著的性能提升,建议对所有文件都激活它,但已经压缩的文件,如图像、音频文件和视频。

trans-unit.source: As compression works better on a specific kind of files, it usually provides nothing to compress them a second time. In fact, this is often counter productive as the cost of the overhead (algorithms usually need a dictionary that add to the initial size) can be higher than the extra gain in compression resulting in a larger file. Do not use the two following techniques for files in a compressed format.
trans-unit.target: 由于压缩在特定类型的文件上效果更好,它通常不会提供任何东西来第二次压缩它们。事实上,这往往是适得其反的,因为开销的成本(算法通常需要一个字典,添加到初始大小)可能高于压缩中的额外收益,导致更大的文件。不要对压缩格式的文件使用以下两种技术。

trans-unit.source: As described in Section 2.3, intermediaries can serve a variety of roles in the processing of HTTP requests and responses. Some intermediaries are used to improve performance or availability. Others are used for access control or to filter content. Since an HTTP stream has characteristics similar to a pipe-and-filter architecture, there are no inherent limits to the extent an intermediary can enhance (or interfere) with either direction of the stream. An intermediary not acting as a tunnel MUST implement the Connection header field, as specified in Section 6.1, and exclude fields from being forwarded that are only intended for the incoming connection. An intermediary MUST NOT forward a message to itself unless it is protected from an infinite request loop. In general, an intermediary ought to recognize its own server names, including any aliases, local variations, or literal IP addresses, and respond to such requests directly.
trans-unit.target: 如2.3节所述，中介可以在HTTP请求和响应的处理中扮演各种角色。一些中介可以用来提高性能或可用性。其他用于访问控制或过滤内容。由于HTTP流具有类似于管道和过滤器体系结构的特性，因此中介程序可以增强（或干扰）流的任一方向的程度没有固有限制。不充当隧道的中介必须实现6.1节中指定的Connection标头字段，并排除仅用于传入连接的字段被转发。中介机构不得将消息转发给自身，除非它受到无限请求循环的保护。通常，中介程序应该识别其自己的服务器名称，包括任何别名，本地变体或文字IP地址，并直接响应此类请求。

trans-unit.source: As discussed above, caching servers will by default match future requests only to requests with exactly the same headers and header values. That means a request will be made to the origin and a new cache will be created for every slight variant that might be specified by different user-agents.
trans-unit.target: 如上所述，默认情况下，缓存服务器将仅将将来的请求与具有完全相同的标头和标头值的请求进行匹配。这意味着将对源进行请求，并为可能由不同的用户代理指定的每个轻微变体创建一个新的缓存。

trans-unit.source: As for MIME types of audio or video files, they typically specify the container format (file type). The optional codecs parameter can be added to the MIME type to further specify which codecs to use and what options were used to encode the media, such as codec profile, level, or other such information.
trans-unit.target: 至于音频或视频文件的MIME类型，它们通常指定容器格式（文件类型）。可以将可选的编解码器参数添加到MIME类型，以进一步指定要使用的编解码器以及用于对媒体进行编码的选项，例如编解码器配置文件，级别或其他此类信息。

trans-unit.source: As for the screen size, simply use window.innerWidth and window.addEventListener("resize", function(){ /*refresh screen size dependent things*/ }). What you want to do for screen size is not slash off information on smaller screens. That will only annoy people because it will force them to use the desktop version. Rather, try to have fewer columns of information in a longer page on smaller screens while having more columns with a shorter page on larger screen sizes. This effect can be easily achieved using CSS flexboxes, sometimes with floats as a partial fallback.
trans-unit.target: 至于屏幕大小，只需使用window.innerWidth和window.addEventListener（“ resize”，function（）{/ *刷新屏幕大小相关的东西* /}）。您要为屏幕尺寸做的事情不是在较小的屏幕上削减信息。这只会使人们感到烦恼，因为它将迫使他们使用桌面版本。而是尝试在较小的屏幕上的较长页面中减少信息列，而在较大的屏幕尺寸上使较短的页面具有更多列。使用CSS flexboxes可以轻松实现此效果，有时使用float作为部分回退。

trans-unit.source: As introduced in Section 8.7, extra information on error conditions can be included in the body of many status responses. This section makes requirements on the use of the error body mechanism and introduces a number of precondition and postcondition codes. A "precondition" of a method describes the state of the server that must be true for that method to be performed. A "postcondition" of a method describes the state of the server that must be true after that method has been completed. Each precondition and postcondition has a unique XML element associated with it. In a 207 Multi-Status response, the XML element MUST appear inside an 'error' element in the appropriate 'propstat or 'response' element depending on whether the condition applies to one or more properties or to the resource as a whole. In all other error responses where this specification's 'error' body is used, the precondition/postcondition XML element MUST be returned as the child of a top-level 'error' element in the response body, unless otherwise negotiated by the request, along with an appropriate response status. The most common response status codes are 403 (Forbidden) if the request should not be repeated because it will always fail, and 409 (Conflict) if it is expected that the user might be able to resolve the conflict and resubmit the request. The 'error' element MAY contain child elements with specific error information and MAY be extended with any custom child elements. This mechanism does not take the place of using a correct numeric status code as defined here or in HTTP, because the client must always be able to take a reasonable course of action based only on the numeric code. However, it does remove the need to define new numeric codes. The new machine-readable codes used for this purpose are XML elements classified as preconditions and postconditions, so naturally, any group defining a new condition code can use their own namespace. As always, the "DAV:" namespace is reserved for use by IETF-chartered WebDAV working groups. A server supporting this specification SHOULD use the XML error whenever a precondition or postcondition defined in this document is violated. For error conditions not specified in this document, the server MAY simply choose an appropriate numeric status and leave the response body blank. However, a server MAY instead use a custom condition code and other supporting text, because even when clients do not automatically recognize condition codes, they can be quite useful in interoperability testing and debugging. Example - Response with precondition code >>Response HTTP/1.1 423 Locked Content-Type: application/xml; charset="utf-8" Content-Length: xxxx <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <D:error xmlns:D="DAV:"> <D:lock-token-submitted> <D:href>/workspace/webdav/</D:href> </D:lock-token-submitted> </D:error> In this example, a client unaware of a depth-infinity lock on the parent collection "/workspace/webdav/" attempted to modify the collection member "/workspace/webdav/proposal.doc". Some other useful preconditions and postconditions have been defined in other specifications extending WebDAV, such as [RFC3744] (see particularly Section 7.1.1), [RFC3253], and [RFC3648]. All these elements are in the "DAV:" namespace. If not specified otherwise, the content for each condition's XML element is defined to be empty. Name: lock-token-matches-request-uri Use with: 409 Conflict Purpose: (precondition) -- A request may include a Lock-Token header to identify a lock for the UNLOCK method. However, if the Request-URI does not fall within the scope of the lock identified by the token, the server SHOULD use this error. The lock may have a scope that does not include the Request-URI, or the lock could have disappeared, or the token may be invalid. Name: lock-token-submitted (precondition) Use with: 423 Locked Purpose: The request could not succeed because a lock token should have been submitted. This element, if present, MUST contain at least one URL of a locked resource that prevented the request. In cases of MOVE, COPY, and DELETE where collection locks are involved, it can be difficult for the client to find out which locked resource made the request fail -- but the server is only responsible for returning one such locked resource. The server MAY return every locked resource that prevented the request from succeeding if it knows them all. <!ELEMENT lock-token-submitted (href+) > Name: no-conflicting-lock (precondition) Use with: Typically 423 Locked Purpose: A LOCK request failed due the presence of an already existing conflicting lock. Note that a lock can be in conflict although the resource to which the request was directed is only indirectly locked. In this case, the precondition code can be used to inform the client about the resource that is the root of the conflicting lock, avoiding a separate lookup of the "lockdiscovery" property. <!ELEMENT no-conflicting-lock (href)* > Name: no-external-entities Use with: 403 Forbidden Purpose: (precondition) -- If the server rejects a client request because the request body contains an external entity, the server SHOULD use this error. Name: preserved-live-properties Use with: 409 Conflict Purpose: (postcondition) -- The server received an otherwise-valid MOVE or COPY request, but cannot maintain the live properties with the same behavior at the destination. It may be that the server only supports some live properties in some parts of the repository, or simply has an internal error. Name: propfind-finite-depth Use with: 403 Forbidden Purpose: (precondition) -- This server does not allow infinite-depth PROPFIND requests on collections. Name: cannot-modify-protected-property Use with: 403 Forbidden Purpose: (precondition) -- The client attempted to set a protected property in a PROPPATCH (such as DAV:getetag). See also [RFC3253], Section 3.12.
trans-unit.target: 如第8.7节所述，许多状态响应的正文中都可以包含有关错误条件的额外信息。本节对错误主体机制的使用提出了要求，并介绍了一些前提条件代码和后置条件代码。方法的“前提”描述了要执行该方法的服务器状态。方法的“后置条件”描述了该方法完成后必须为真的服务器状态。每个前置条件和后置条件都有一个与其关联的唯一XML元素。在207多状态响应中，XML元素必须出现在适当的“ propstat或”响应”中的“错误”元素内元素取决于条件是适用于一个或多个属性还是适用于整个资源。在使用此规范的“错误”正文的所有其他错误响应中，除非条件另有要求，否则前提条件/后置条件XML元素必须作为响应正文中顶级“错误”元素的子元素返回。适当的响应状态。如果不应因为请求总是失败而重复请求，则最常见的响应状态代码是403（禁止），如果期望用户可能能够解决冲突并重新提交请求，则最常见的响应状态代码是409（冲突）。 “错误”元素可以包含具有特定错误信息的子元素，并可以使用任何自定义子元素进行扩展。此机制不能代替使用此处或在HTTP中定义的正确数字状态代码，因为客户端必须始终能够仅基于数字代码采取合理的措施。但是，它确实不需要定义新的数字代码。用于此目的的新机器可读代码是归类为前提条件和后置条件的XML元素，因此，自然而然地，定义新条件代码的任何组都可以使用其自己的名称空间。与往常一样，“ DAV：”名称空间保留供IETF特许的WebDAV工作组使用。每当违反本文档中定义的前置条件或后置条件时，支持该规范的服务器应使用XML错误。对于本文档未指定的错误情况，服务器可以简单地选择一个适当的数字状态并将响应主体留空。但是，服务器可以改用自定义条件代码和其他支持文本，因为即使客户端不能自动识别条件代码，它们在互操作性测试和调试中也非常有用。示例-带有前提条件代码的响应>>响应HTTP / 1.1 423锁定的内容类型：application / xml; charset =“ utf-8”内容长度：xxxx <？xml version =“ 1.0” encoding =“ utf-8”吗？> <D：错误xmlns：D =“ DAV：”> <D：已提交锁令牌> <D：href> / workspace / webdav / </ D：href> </ D：lock-token-submitted> </ D：error>在此示例中，客户端未意识到父集合“ / workspace / webdav /”上的深度无穷大锁定，则试图修改集合成员“ /workspace/webdav/proposal.doc”。在扩展WebDAV的其他规范中定义了一些其他有用的前提条件和后置条件，例如[RFC3744 ]（特别是参见第7.1.1节），[ RFC3253 ]和[ RFC3648]。所有这些元素都在“ DAV：”命名空间中。如果没有另外指定，则将每个条件的XML元素的内容定义为空。名称：lock-token-matches-request-uri与以下对象一起使用：409冲突目的：（前提条件）-请求可能包含Lock-Token标头，以标识用于UNLOCK方法的锁。但是，如果Request-URI不在令牌标识的锁定范围内，则服务器应使用此错误。锁的范围可能不包含Request-URI，或者锁可能已消失，或者令牌可能无效。名称：提交了锁令牌（前提）与：423锁定目的：由于应该已提交锁令牌，因此请求无法成功。该元素（如果存在）必须包含阻止请求的锁定资源的至少一个URL。在涉及收集锁定的MOVE，COPY和DELETE情况下，客户端可能很难找出哪个锁定资源导致请求失败-但是服务器仅负责返回一个这样的锁定资源。服务器可以返回所有锁定的资源，如果它们知道所有这些资源，则该资源将阻止请求成功。 <！ELEMENT提交的已提交锁令牌（href +）>名称：无冲突锁（前提条件）与以下对象一起使用：通常是423锁定目的：由于存在已存在的冲突锁，导致LOCK请求失败。请注意，尽管仅将请求定向到的资源间接锁定，但锁定可能会发生冲突。在这种情况下，前提条件代码可用于通知客户端有关冲突锁根源的资源，从而避免了对“ lockdiscovery”属性的单独查找。 <！ELEMENT no-conflicting-lock（href）*>名称：no-external-entities与以下对象一起使用：403禁止用途：（前提条件）-如果服务器由于请求主体包含外部实体而拒绝了客户端请求，则该服务器应该使用这个错误。名称：preserved-live-properties用于：409冲突目的：（后置条件）-服务器收到了其他有效的MOVE或COPY请求，但无法在目标位置维护具有相同行为的实时属性。服务器可能仅在存储库的某些部分中支持某些活动属性，或仅仅是内部错误。名称：propfind-finite-depth与以下对象一起使用：403禁止用途：（前提条件）-此服务器不允许对集合进行无限深度的PROPFIND请求。名称：无法修改保护属性与：403禁止使用：（前提条件）-客户端试图在PROPPATCH中设置受保护的属性（例如DAV：getetag）。也可以看看 [RFC3253]，第3.12节。

trans-unit.source: As is the case for images, HTML doesn't mandate that web browsers support any specific file and codec types for the <audio> and <video> elements, so it's important to consider your target audience and the range of browsers (and versions of those browsers) they may be using when choosing the file type and codecs to use for media.
trans-unit.target: 与图像一样，HTML并不要求Web浏览器支持 <audio> 和 <video> 元素的任何特定文件和编解码器类型，因此，重要的是要考虑目标受众和浏览器的范围（以及那些浏览器），它们在选择用于媒体的文件类型和编解码器时可能会使用。

trans-unit.source: As long as the identity value, meaning no encoding, is not explicitly forbidden, by an identity;q=0 or a *;q=0 without another explicitly set value for identity, the server must never send back a 406Not Acceptable error.
trans-unit.target: 只要没有显式设置 identity 值没有被 identity;q=0 或 *;q=0 明确禁止禁止没有任何编码的身份值，服务器就绝不能发回 406 Not Acceptable 错误。

trans-unit.source: As long as the cache is not stale, no requests are issued at all. But once it has become stale, this is mostly controlled by the Cache-Control header, the client doesn't use the cached value directly but issues a conditional request. The value of the validator is used as a parameter of the If-Modified-Since and If-Match headers.
trans-unit.target: 只要缓存不是陈旧的，就不会发出任何请求。但是，一旦过时，它主要由 Cache-Control 标头控制，客户端不会直接使用缓存的值，而是发出条件请求。验证器的值用作 If-Modified-Since 和 If-Match 标头的参数。

trans-unit.source: As of Firefox 68, https pages are not permitted to access http://localhost, although this may be changed by Bug 1488740.
trans-unit.target: 从Firefox 68开始， https 页面不允许访问 http://localhost ，尽管Bug 1488740可能更改了此页面。

trans-unit.source: As of HTTP/1.1, the connection is no longer closed after completing the third phase, and the client is now granted a further request: this means the second and third phases can now be performed any number of times.
trans-unit.target: 从HTTP/1.1开始,在完成第三阶段后,连接不再被关闭,客户机现在可以获得进一步的请求:这意味着第二和第三阶段现在可以执行任何次数。

trans-unit.source: As of June 2019, the spec draft and Google Chrome set default allow list to *.
trans-unit.target: 自2019年6月起，规范草案和Google Chrome浏览器将默认允许列表设置为 * 。

trans-unit.source: As seen above, the noreferrer link relation is written without a dash — noreferrer. When the referrer policy is specified for the entire document with a <meta> element, it's written with a dash: <meta name="referrer" content="no-referrer">.
trans-unit.target: 如上所示， noreferrer 链接关系的编写不带破折号— noreferrer 。当用于与整个文档中指定的引用者策略 <meta> 元素，它的写入用破折号： <meta name="referrer" content="no-referrer"> 。

trans-unit.source: As seen earlier, in most cases, looking for the rendering engine is a better way to go. This will help to not exclude lesser known browsers. Browsers sharing a common rendering engine will display a page in the same way: it is often a fair assumption that what will work in one will work in the other.
trans-unit.target: 如前所述,在大多数情况下,寻找渲染引擎是一个比较好的方法。这将有助于不排除不太知名的浏览器。共享一个共同的渲染引擎的浏览器将以同样的方式显示页面:通常一个公平的假设是,在一个浏览器中可以工作的东西将在另一个浏览器中工作。

trans-unit.source: As several representations of a given resource are sent, shared caches are less efficient and server implementations are more complex.
trans-unit.target: 由于一个给定资源的多个表示会被发送,共享缓存的效率较低,服务器的实现也比较复杂。

trans-unit.source: As the above code demonstrates, there is always a way to test browser support on anything, no exceptions. There never any reason to check the user string for this.
trans-unit.target: 如上面的代码所示，总有一种方法可以测试浏览器对任何事物的支持，没有例外。有从来没有任何理由检查该用户的字符串。

trans-unit.source: As the above code demonstrates, there is always a way to test browser support without user agent sniffing. There is never any reason to check the user agent string for this.
trans-unit.target: 如以上代码所示，总有一种方法可以测试浏览器支持，而无需用户代理嗅探。有从来没有任何理由检查该用户代理字符串。

trans-unit.source: As the name implies, a reverse proxy does the opposite of what a forward proxy does: A forward proxy acts in behalf of clients (or requesting hosts), a reverse proxy acts in behalf of servers. Forward proxies can hide the identities of clients whereas reverse proxies can hide the identities of servers. Reverse proxies have several use cases, a few are:
trans-unit.target: 顾名思义,反向代理与正向代理的作用正好相反。正向代理代表客户(或请求主机),反向代理代表服务器。正向代理可以隐藏客户端的身份,而反向代理可以隐藏服务器的身份。反向代理有几种使用情况,几种情况是:1:

Forward proxies can hide the identities of clients whereas reverse proxies can hide the identities of servers. Reverse proxies have several use cases, a few are:

trans-unit.source: As the user ID and password are passed over the network as clear text (it is base64 encoded, but base64 is a reversible encoding), the basic authentication scheme is not secure. HTTPS/TLS should be used with basic authentication. Without these additional security enhancements, basic authentication should not be used to protect sensitive or valuable information.
trans-unit.target: 由于用户ID和密码以明文形式（通过base64编码，但是base64是可逆编码）通过网络传递，因此基本身份验证方案并不安全。HTTPS / TLS应该与基本身份验证一起使用。如果没有这些附加的安全性增强功能，则不应使用基本身份验证来保护敏感或有价值的信息。

trans-unit.source: As the user ID and password are passed over the network as clear text (it is base64 encoded, but base64 is a reversible encoding), the basic authentication scheme is not secure. HTTPS / TLS should be used in conjunction with basic authentication. Without these additional security enhancements, basic authentication should not be used to protect sensitive or valuable information.
trans-unit.target: 由于用户ID和密码是以明文形式在网络上传递的(它是base64编码,但base64是一种可逆的编码),所以基本认证方案并不安全。HTTPS/TLS应该与基本认证结合使用。如果没有这些额外的安全增强功能,就不应该使用基本认证来保护敏感或有价值的信息。

trans-unit.source: As there is no uniformity of the different part of the user agent string, this is the tricky part.
trans-unit.target: 由于用户代理字符串的不同部分没有统一性,这就是棘手的部分。

trans-unit.source: As this policy is expressed via a response header, the actual request is not prevented—rather, the browser prevents the result from being leaked by stripping the response body.
trans-unit.target: 由于此策略是通过响应标头表示的，因此不会阻止实际的请求-相反，浏览器通过剥离响应正文来防止结果泄漏。

trans-unit.source: As well as styles that are applied in JavaScript by setting the style attribute directly, or by setting cssText:
trans-unit.target: 以及通过直接设置 style 属性或通过设置 cssText 在JavaScript中应用的样式：

trans-unit.source: As well as styles that are applied in Javascript by setting the style attribute directly, or by setting cssText:
trans-unit.target: 以及通过直接设置 style 属性或通过设置 cssText 在Javascript中应用的样式：

trans-unit.source: As with XSS, input filtering is important.
trans-unit.target: 与XSS一样，输入过滤也很重要。

trans-unit.source: As you can see, the report includes the full path to the violating resource in blocked-uri. This is not always the case. For example, if the signup.html attempted to load CSS from http://anothercdn.example.com/stylesheet.css, the browser would not include the full path, but only the origin (http://anothercdn.example.com). The CSP specification gives an explanation of this odd behaviour. In summary, this is done to prevent leaking sensitive information about cross-origin resources.
trans-unit.target: 如您所见，报告在 blocked-uri 中包含了违规资源的完整路径。这并非总是如此。例如，如果 signup.html 尝试从 http://anothercdn.example.com/stylesheet.css 加载CSS ，则浏览器将不包含完整路径，而仅包含原始路径（ http://anothercdn.example.com ）。CSP规范对这种奇怪的行为进行了解释。总之，这样做是为了防止泄漏有关跨域资源的敏感信息。

For example, if the signup.html attempted to load CSS from http://anothercdn.example.com/stylesheet.css, the browser would not include the full path, but only the origin (http://anothercdn.example.com). The CSP specification gives an explanation of this odd behaviour. In summary, this is done to prevent leaking sensitive information about cross-origin resources.

trans-unit.source: Asserts that a cookie must not be sent with cross-origin requests, providing some protection against cross-site request forgery attacks (CSRF).
trans-unit.target: 断言cookie一定不能与跨域请求一起发送，从而为跨站点请求伪造攻击（CSRF）提供了一定的保护。

trans-unit.source: Associates a specific cryptographic public key with a certain web server to decrease the risk of MITM attacks with forged certificates.
trans-unit.target: 将特定的加密公共密钥与某个Web服务器关联，以降低使用伪造证书进行MITM攻击的风险。

trans-unit.source: At this point, a typical request and response looked like this:
trans-unit.target: 此时,一个典型的请求和响应是这样的。

trans-unit.source: Atom Entry and Feed Documents can contain XML Digital Signatures [REC-xmldsig-core] and can be encrypted using XML Encryption [REC-xmlenc-core] as specified in Section 5 of [RFC4287]. Handling of signatures and encrypted elements in Atom documents is discussed in Sections 5 and 6.3 of [RFC4287]. Neither servers nor clients are under any obligation to support encryption and digital signature of Entries or Feeds, although it is certainly possible that in some installations, clients or servers might require signing or encrypting of the documents exchanged in the Atom Protocol. Because servers are allowed (and in some cases, expected) to modify the contents of an Entry Document before publishing it, signatures within an entry are only likely to be useful to the server to which the entry is being sent. Clients cannot assume that the signature will be valid when viewed by a third party, or even that the server will publish the client's signature. A server is allowed to strip client-applied signatures, to strip client-applied signatures and then re-sign with its own public key, and to oversign an entry with its own public key. The meaning to a third party of a signature applied by a server is the same as a signature from anyone, as described in [RFC4287]. It is RECOMMENDED that a server that is aware that it has changed any part of an Entry Document that was signed by the client should strip that signature before publishing the entry in order to prevent third parties from trying to interpret a signature that cannot be validated.
trans-unit.target: Atom条目和Feed文档可以包含XML数字签名[ REC-xmldsig-core ]，并且可以使用XML加密[ REC-xmlenc-core ] 进行加密，如[RFC4287]的第5节中所指定。[ RFC4287的第5和6.3节]中讨论了Atom文档中签名和加密元素的处理。]。服务器和客户端都不承担支持条目或源的加密和数字签名的义务，尽管在某些安装中客户端或服务器可能有必要对Atom协议中交换的文档进行签名或加密。由于允许（在某些情况下是预期的）服务器在发布条目文档之前对其进行修改，因此条目中的签名仅可能对条目所发送到的服务器有用。客户端不能假定签名在被第三方查看时将是有效的，甚至不能假设服务器将发布客户端的签名。允许服务器剥离客户端应用的签名，剥离客户端应用的签名，然后使用其自己的公钥重新签名，并使用其自己的公钥对条目进行签名。服务器所应用的签名对第三方的含义与任何人的签名相同，如[RFC4287 ]。建议服务器知道它已更改了由客户端签名的条目文档的任何部分，应在发布条目之前删除该签名，以防止第三方尝试解释无法验证的签名。

trans-unit.source: Atom Feed and Entry Documents can contain XML External Entities as defined in Section 4.2.2 of [REC-xml]. Atom implementations are not required to load external entities. External entities are subject to the same security concerns as any network operation and can alter the semantics of an Atom document. The same issues exist for Resources linked to by Atom elements such as atom:link and atom:content.
trans-unit.target: Atom Feed和Entry文档可以包含[ REC-xml ]的4.2.2节中定义的XML外部实体。不需要Atom实现来加载外部实体。外部实体与任何网络操作都受到相同的安全问题，并且可以更改Atom文档的语义。对于通过Atom元素（例如atom：link和atom：content）链接到的资源，也存在同样的问题。

trans-unit.source: Atom Feed and Entry Documents can contain a broad range of content types including code that might be executable in some contexts. Malicious clients could attempt to attack servers or other clients by injecting code into a Collection Document's Entry or Media Resources. Server implementations are strongly encouraged to verify that client- supplied content is safe prior to accepting, processing, or publishing it. In the case of HTML, experience indicates that verification based on a white list of acceptable content is more effective than a black list of forbidden content. Additional information about XHTML and HTML content safety can be found in Section 8.1 of [RFC4287].
trans-unit.target: Atom提要和进入文档可以包含多种内容类型，包括在某些情况下可以执行的代码。恶意客户端可能通过将代码注入“收集文档”的条目或媒体资源来尝试攻击服务器或其他客户端。强烈建议服务器实现在接受，处理或发布之前，先验证客户端提供的内容是否安全。对于HTML，经验表明，基于可接受内容的白名单进行的验证比禁止内容的黑名单更为有效。有关XHTML和HTML内容安全性的其他信息，可以在[RFC4287]的8.1节中找到。

trans-unit.source: Atom Protocol Document formats are specified in terms of the XML Information Set [REC-xml-infoset], serialized as XML 1.0 [REC-xml]. The Infoset terms "Element Information Item" and "Attribute Information Item" are shortened to "element" and "attribute" respectively. Therefore, when this specification uses the term "element", it is referring to an Element Information Item, and when it uses the term "attribute", it is referring to an Attribute Information Item.
trans-unit.target: Atom协议文档格式是根据XML信息集[ REC-xml-infoset ]指定的，序列化为XML 1.0 [ REC-xml ]。 Infoset术语“元素信息项”和“属性信息项”分别缩短为“元素”和“属性”。因此，当本说明书使用术语“元素”时，它是指元素信息项，而当使用术语“属性”时，它是指属性信息项。

trans-unit.source: Atom Protocol documents allow the use of IRIs [RFC3987] as well as URIs [RFC3986] to identify Resources. Before an IRI in a document is used by HTTP, the IRI is first converted to a URI according to the procedure defined in Section 3.1 of [RFC3987]. In accordance with that specification, the conversion SHOULD be applied as late as possible. Conversion does not imply Resource creation -- the IRI and the URI into which it is converted identify the same Resource. While the Atom Protocol specifies the formats of the representations that are exchanged and the actions that can be performed on the IRIs embedded in those representations, it does not constrain the form of the URIs that are used. HTTP [RFC2616] specifies that the URI space of each server is controlled by that server, and this protocol imposes no further constraints on that control.
trans-unit.target: Atom协议文档允许使用IRI [ RFC3987 ]和URI [ RFC3986 ]来标识资源。在HTTP中使用文档中的IRI之前，首先根据[RFC3987]第3.1节中定义的过程将IRI转换为URI 。根据该规范，转换应尽可能晚地应用。转换并不意味着创建资源-IRI和将其转换为URI标识相同的资源。尽管Atom协议指定了交换的表示形式的格式以及可以对嵌入在这些表示形式中的IRI执行的动作，但它并不限制所使用URI的形式。 HTTP [ RFC2616]指定每个服务器的URI空间由该服务器控制，并且此协议没有对该控件施加任何进一步的约束。

trans-unit.source: Atom Publishing Protocol implementations are susceptible to a variety of spoofing attacks. Malicious clients might send Atom Entries containing inaccurate information anywhere in the document.
trans-unit.target: Atom发布协议的实现很容易受到各种欺骗攻击。恶意的客户端可能会在文档的任何地方发送包含不准确信息的Atom Entries。

trans-unit.source: Atom Publishing Protocol implementations handle URIs and IRIs. See Section 7 of [RFC3986] and Section 8 of [RFC3987] for security considerations related to their handling and use. The Atom Publishing Protocol leaves the server in control of minting URIs. The use of any client-supplied data for creating new URIs is subject to the same concerns as described in the next section.
trans-unit.target: Atom发布协议实现可处理URI和IRI。见 第7 [RFC3986]和[RFC3987]第8条对关系到他们的操作和使用安全方面的考虑。Atom发布协议使服务器可以控制URI。使用客户端提供的任何数据来创建新URI都将受到与下一节所述相同的关注。

trans-unit.source: Atom Publishing Protocol server implementations are susceptible to replay attacks. Specifically, this specification does not define a means of detecting duplicate requests. Accidentally sent duplicate requests are indistinguishable from intentional and malicious replay attacks.
trans-unit.target: Atom发布协议服务器实现很容易受到重放攻击。具体来说,本规范没有定义检测重复请求的方法。意外发送的重复请求与故意和恶意的重放攻击是无法区分的。

trans-unit.source: Atom Publishing Protocol server implementations need to take adequate precautions to ensure malicious clients cannot consume excessive server resources (CPU, memory, disk, etc.).
trans-unit.target: Atom发布协议服务器的实现需要采取足够的预防措施,以确保恶意客户端无法消耗过多的服务器资源(CPU、内存、磁盘等)。

trans-unit.source:
Attribute Value: edit
Description: An IRI of an editable Member Entry. When appearing within an atom:entry, the href IRI can be used to retrieve, update, and delete the Resource represented by that Entry.
Expected display characteristics: Undefined; this relation can be used for background processing or to provide extended functionality without displaying its value.
Security considerations: Automated agents should take care when this relation crosses administrative domains (e.g., the URI has a different authority than the current document).
trans-unit.target: 属性值:edit 描述:一个可编辑的成员条目的IRI。一个可编辑的成员条目的IRI。当出现在atom:entry中时,href IRI可以用来检索、更新和删除该entry所代表的资源。预期的显示特性。未定义;此关系可用于后台处理或提供扩展功能而不显示其值。安全性考虑因素:未定义;此关系可用于后台处理或提供扩展功能而不显示其值。当这种关系跨越管理域时,自动代理应小心谨慎(例如,URI与当前文件的权限不同)。

trans-unit.source:
Attribute Value: edit-media
Description: An IRI of an editable Media Resource. When appearing within an atom:entry, the href IRI can be used to retrieve, update, and delete the Media Resource associated with that Entry.
Expected display characteristics: Undefined; this relation can be used for background processing or to provide extended functionality without displaying its value.
Security considerations: Automated agents should take care when this relation crosses administrative domains (e.g., the URI has a different authority than the current document).
trans-unit.target: 属性值:edit-media 描述:一个可编辑的媒体资源的IRI。一个可编辑的媒体资源的IRI。当出现在atom:entry中时,href IRI可以用来检索、更新和删除与该entry相关的媒体资源。预期的显示特性。未定义;此关系可用于后台处理或提供扩展功能而不显示其值。安全性考虑因素:未定义;此关系可用于后台处理或提供扩展功能而不显示其值。当此关系跨越管理域时,自动代理应小心谨慎(例如,URI与当前文件的权限不同)。

trans-unit.source: Audio and video types
trans-unit.target: 音频和视频类型

trans-unit.source: Audio and video. Only resources with the correct MIME Type will be played in <video> or <audio> elements. Be sure to use the correct type for audio and video.
trans-unit.target: 音频和视频。只有具有正确MIME类型的资源才能在 <video> 或 <audio> 元素中播放。确保对音频和视频使用正确的类型。

trans-unit.source: Audio and video. Only resources with the correct MIME Type will be played in <video> or <audio> elements. Be sure to specify the correct media type for audio and video.
trans-unit.target: 音频和视频。只有具有正确MIME类型的资源才会在 <video> 或 <audio> 元素中播放。确保为音频和视频指定正确的媒体类型。

trans-unit.source: Audio or music data. Examples include audio/mpeg, audio/vorbis.
trans-unit.target: 音频或音乐数据。示例包括 audio/mpeg ， audio/vorbis 。

trans-unit.source: Audio or video type
trans-unit.target: 音频或视频类型

trans-unit.source: Authentication
trans-unit.target: Authentication

trans-unit.source: Authentication challenges indicate what mechanisms are available for the client to provide authentication credentials in future requests. +--------------------+--------------------------+ | Header Field Name | Defined in... | +--------------------+--------------------------+ | WWW-Authenticate | Section 4.1 of [RFC7235] | | Proxy-Authenticate | Section 4.3 of [RFC7235] | +--------------------+--------------------------+
Authentication of cross-origin images
trans-unit.target: 跨源图像的认证

trans-unit.source: Authentication schemes
trans-unit.target: 认证计划

trans-unit.source: Authentication schemes that solely rely on the "realm" mechanism for establishing a protection space will expose credentials to all resources on an origin server. Clients that have successfully made authenticated requests with a resource can use the same authentication credentials for other resources on the same origin server. This makes it possible for a different resource to harvest authentication credentials for other resources. This is of particular concern when an origin server hosts resources for multiple parties under the same canonical root URI (Section 2.2). Possible mitigation strategies include restricting direct access to authentication credentials (i.e., not making the content of the Authorization request header field available), and separating protection spaces by using a different host name (or port number) for each party.
trans-unit.target: 仅依靠“领域”机制来建立保护空间的身份验证方案会将凭据公开给原始服务器上的所有资源。使用资源成功发出身份验证请求的客户端可以对同一原始服务器上的其他资源使用相同的身份验证凭据。这使得其他资源可以收获其他资源的身份验证凭据。当原始服务器在相同的规范根URI下托管多方资源时，这尤其令人关注（第2.2节）。可能的缓解策略包括限制对身份验证凭据的直接访问（即，不使授权请求标头字段的内容可用），以及通过为各方使用不同的主机名（或端口号）来分隔保护空间。

trans-unit.source: Authentification for AWS servers (AWS4-HMAC-SHA256)
trans-unit.target: AWS服务器的认证（ AWS4-HMAC-SHA256 ）

trans-unit.source: Avoid overly-detailed Server values, as they can reveal information that might make it (slightly) easier for attackers to exploit known security holes.
trans-unit.target: 避免使用过多的 Server 值，因为它们会泄露可能使攻击者（略）容易地利用它的信息，从而使攻击者无法利用已知的安全漏洞。

trans-unit.source: Base64 encoding and decoding
trans-unit.target: Base64编码和解码

trans-unit.source: Base64 encoding of a file or string on Linux and Mac OS X systems can be achieved using the command-line base64 (or, as an alternative, the uuencode utility with -m argument).
trans-unit.target: 在Linux和Mac OS X系统上，文件或字符串的Base64编码可以使用命令行 base64 （或者作为替代，使用带有 -m 参数的 uuencode 实用程序）来实现。

trans-unit.source: Base64 is a group of binary-to-text encoding schemes that represent binary data in an ASCII string format by translating it into a radix-64 representation. By consisting only in ASCII characters, base64 strings are generally url-safe, and that's why they can be used to encode data in Data URLs.
trans-unit.target: Base64是一组二进制到文本的编码方案,通过将ASCII字符串格式的二进制数据翻译成radix-64表示法来表示。通过只由ASCII字符组成,base64字符串通常是url安全的,这就是为什么它们可以用于编码数据URL中的数据。

trans-unit.source: Because Upgrade is a hop-by-hop header, it also needs to be listed in the Connection header field. This means that a typical request that includes Upgrade would look something like:
trans-unit.target: 由于 Upgrade 是逐跳标题，因此还需要在“ Connection 标题字段中列出它。这意味着一个包含升级的典型请求如下所示：

trans-unit.source: Because HTTP uses mostly textual, character-delimited fields, parsers are often vulnerable to attacks based on sending very long (or very slow) streams of data, particularly where an implementation is expecting a protocol element with no predefined length. To promote interoperability, specific recommendations are made for minimum size limits on request-line (Section 3.1.1) and header fields (Section 3.2). These are minimum recommendations, chosen to be supportable even by implementations with limited resources; it is expected that most implementations will choose substantially higher limits. A server can reject a message that has a request-target that is too long (Section 6.5.12 of [RFC7231]) or a request payload that is too large (Section 6.5.11 of [RFC7231]). Additional status codes related to capacity limits have been defined by extensions to HTTP [RFC6585]. Recipients ought to carefully limit the extent to which they process other protocol elements, including (but not limited to) request methods, response status phrases, header field-names, numeric values, and body chunks. Failure to limit such processing can result in buffer overflows, arithmetic overflows, or increased vulnerability to denial-of-service attacks.
trans-unit.target: 因为HTTP主要使用文本，字符分隔的字段，所以解析器通常容易受到基于发送非常长（或非常慢）的数据流的攻击，特别是在实现中期望协议元素没有预定义长度的情况下。为了促进互操作性，针对请求行（第3.1.1节）和标头字段（第3.2 节）的最小大小限制提出了具体的建议。这些是最低限度的建议，即使在资源有限的情况下也可以支持。预期大多数实现将选择更高的限制。服务器可以拒绝请求目标太长的消息（[RFC7231]的6.5.12节））或太大的请求有效载荷（[RFC7231]的6.5.11节）。 HTTP [ RFC6585 ]的扩展定义了与容量限制有关的其他状态代码。收件人应谨慎限制他们处理其他协议元素的程度，包括（但不限于）请求方法，响应状态短语，标头字段名称，数值和主体块。不能限制此类处理会导致缓冲区溢出，算术溢出或拒绝服务攻击的漏洞增加。

trans-unit.source:
Because a client might be receiving responses via multiple paths, so that some responses flow through one set of caches and other responses flow through a different set of caches, a client might receive responses in an order different from that in which the origin server sent them. We would like the client to use the most recently generated response, even if older responses are still apparently fresh.
Neither the entity tag nor the expiration value can impose an ordering on responses, since it is possible that a later response intentionally carries an earlier expiration time. The Date values are ordered to a granularity of one second.
When a client tries to revalidate a cache entry, and the response it receives contains a Date header that appears to be older than the one for the existing entry, then the client SHOULD repeat the request unconditionally, and include
Cache-Control: max-age=0
to force any intermediate caches to validate their copies directly with the origin server, or
Cache-Control: no-cache
to force any intermediate caches to obtain a new copy from the origin server.
If the Date values are equal, then the client MAY use either response (or MAY, if it is being extremely prudent, request a new response). Servers MUST NOT depend on clients being able to choose deterministically between responses generated during the same second, if their expiration times overlap.
trans-unit.target: 由于客户端可能通过多条路径接收响应,因此一些响应流经一组缓存,而其他响应则流经另一组缓存,因此客户端接收响应的顺序可能与源服务器发送响应的顺序不同。我们希望客户端使用最近生成的响应,即使旧的响应显然仍然是新鲜的。实体标记或过期值都不能对响应施加顺序,因为较晚的响应有可能故意携带较早的过期时间。Date 值的排序粒度为一秒。当客户端试图重新验证一个缓存条目,而它收到的响应包含一个似乎比现有条目的Date头更老的Date头时,客户端应该无条件地重复请求,并包含Cache-Control:max-age=0来强制任何中间缓存直接与源服务器验证他们的副本,或者Cache-Control:no-cache来强制任何中间缓存从源服务器获得一个新的副本。如果Date值相等,那么客户端可以使用任何一个响应(或者,如果非常谨慎,可以请求一个新的响应)。服务器绝不能依赖客户机能够在同一秒内生成的响应之间进行确定的选择,如果它们的过期时间是重叠的。

trans-unit.source: Because expiration values are assigned optimistically, it is possible for two caches to contain fresh values for the same resource that are different. If a client performing a retrieval receives a non-first-hand response for a request that was already fresh in its own cache, and the Date header in its existing cache entry is newer than the Date on the new response, then the client MAY ignore the response. If so, it MAY retry the request with a "Cache-Control: max-age=0" directive (see section 14.9), to force a check with the origin server. If a cache has two fresh responses for the same representation with different validators, it MUST use the one with the more recent Date header. This situation might arise because the cache is pooling responses from other caches, or because a client has asked for a reload or a revalidation of an apparently fresh cache entry.
trans-unit.target: 因为过期值是乐观分配的，所以两个缓存可能包含相同资源的不同的新值。如果执行检索的客户端收到对自己缓存中已经新鲜的请求的非第一手响应，并且其现有缓存条目中的Date标头比新响应中的Date更新，则客户端可以忽略响应。如果是这样，它可以使用“ Cache-Control：max-age = 0”指令重试该请求（参见 第14.9节）。），以强制与原始服务器进行检查。如果高速缓存对具有不同验证器的同一表示具有两个新的响应，则它必须使用具有更新的Date标头的一个响应。之所以会出现这种情况，是因为该缓存正在合并来自其他缓存的响应，或者是因为客户端请求重新加载或重新验证看似新的缓存条目。

trans-unit.source: Because some of the information shared by resource: URLs is available to websites, a web page could run internal scripts and inspect internal resources of Firefox, including the default preferences, which could be a serious security and privacy issue.
trans-unit.target: 由于网站可以使用 resource: URL 共享的某些信息，因此网页可以运行内部脚本并检查Firefox的内部资源，包括默认首选项，这可能是一个严重的安全和隐私问题。

trans-unit.source: Because the User-Agent header value is different ("varies") for mobile and desktop clients, caches will not be used to serve mobile content mistakenly to desktop users or vice versa.
trans-unit.target: 因为移动客户端和桌面客户端的 User-Agent 标头值不同（“变量”），所以不会将缓存用于错误地为桌面用户提供移动内容，反之亦然。

trans-unit.source: Because the request headers in the above example include a Cookie header, the request would fail if the value of the Access-Control-Allow-Origin header was "*". But it does not fail: Because the value of the Access-Control-Allow-Origin header is "http://foo.example" (an actual origin) rather than the "*" wildcard, the credential-cognizant content is returned to the invoking web content.
trans-unit.target: 因为上面示例中的请求标头包含 Cookie 标头，所以如果 Access-Control-Allow-Origin 标头的值为“ *” ，则请求将失败。但这不会失败：因为 Access-Control-Allow-Origin 标头的值是“ http://foo.example ”（实际来源）而不是通配符“ * ”，所以将凭证识别内容返回到调用网页内容。

trans-unit.source: Because the request headers in the above example include a Cookie header, the request would fail if the value of the Access-Control-Allow-Origin header were "*". But it does not fail: Because the value of the Access-Control-Allow-Origin header is "http://foo.example" (an actual origin) rather than the "*" wildcard, the credential-cognizant content is returned to the invoking web content.
trans-unit.target: 因为上面示例中的请求标头包含 Cookie 标头，所以如果 Access-Control-Allow-Origin 标头的值为“ *” ，则请求将失败。但这不会失败：因为 Access-Control-Allow-Origin 标头的值是“ http://foo.example ”（实际来源），而不是通配符“ * ”，所以将凭证识别内容返回到调用网页内容。

trans-unit.source:
Because the source of a link might be private information or might reveal an otherwise private information source, it is strongly recommended that the user be able to select whether or not the Referer field is sent. For example, a browser client could have a toggle switch for browsing openly/anonymously, which would respectively enable/disable the sending of Referer and From information.
Clients SHOULD NOT include a Referer header field in a (non-secure) HTTP request if the referring page was transferred with a secure protocol.
Authors of services which use the HTTP protocol SHOULD NOT use GET based forms for the submission of sensitive data, because this will cause this data to be encoded in the Request-URI. Many existing servers, proxies, and user agents will log the request URI in some place where it might be visible to third parties. Servers can use POST-based form submission instead
trans-unit.target: 因为一个链接的来源可能是私人信息,或者可能会暴露出一个本来是私人信息的来源,所以强烈建议用户能够选择是否发送Referer字段。例如,浏览器客户端可以有一个公开/匿名浏览的切换开关,可以分别启用/禁用发送Referer和From信息。如果引用页面是用安全协议传输的,客户端就不应该在(非安全的)HTTP请求中包含一个Referer头字段。使用HTTP协议的服务的作者不应该使用基于GET的形式来提交敏感数据,因为这会导致这些数据在Request-URI中被编码。许多现有的服务器、代理和用户代理会将请求URI记录在第三方可能看到的地方。服务器可以使用基于POST的表单提交代替

trans-unit.source: Because unsafe request methods (Section 4.2.1 of [RFC7231]) such as PUT, POST or DELETE have the potential for changing state on the origin server, intervening caches can use them to keep their contents up to date. A cache MUST invalidate the effective Request URI (Section 5.5 of [RFC7230]) as well as the URI(s) in the Location and Content-Location response header fields (if present) when a non-error status code is received in response to an unsafe request method. However, a cache MUST NOT invalidate a URI from a Location or Content-Location response header field if the host part of that URI differs from the host part in the effective request URI (Section 5.5 of [RFC7230]). This helps prevent denial-of-service attacks. A cache MUST invalidate the effective request URI (Section 5.5 of [RFC7230]) when it receives a non-error response to a request with a method whose safety is unknown. Here, a "non-error response" is one with a 2xx (Successful) or 3xx (Redirection) status code. "Invalidate" means that the cache will either remove all stored responses related to the effective request URI or will mark these as "invalid" and in need of a mandatory validation before they can be sent in response to a subsequent request. Note that this does not guarantee that all appropriate responses are invalidated. For example, a state-changing request might invalidate responses in the caches it travels through, but relevant responses still might be stored in other caches that it has not.
trans-unit.target: 由于不安全的请求方法（[RFC7231]的4.2.1节）（例如PUT，POST或DELETE）有可能更改原始服务器上的状态，因此介入式缓存可以使用它们来使内容保持最新。当响应以下内容收到非错误状态代码时，缓存必须使有效的请求URI（[RFC7230]的5.5节）以及位置和内容位置响应头字段（如果存在）中的URI无效。不安全的请求方法。但是，如果该URI的主机部分与有效请求URI中的主机部分不同，则高速缓存绝对不能使Location或Content-Location响应头字段中的URI无效（[RFC7230] 5.5节））。这有助于防止拒绝服务攻击。缓存务必使有效请求URI无效（[RFC7230]第5.5节）使用安全性未知的方法收到对请求的非错误响应。在这里，“非错误响应”是带有2xx（成功）或3xx（重定向）状态代码的响应。 “无效”表示高速缓存将删除所有与有效请求URI相关的已存储响应，或者将其标记为“无效”，并且需要先进行强制验证，然后才能发送它们以响应后续请求。请注意，这不能保证所有适当的响应都无效。例如，状态更改请求可能会使它所经过的缓存中的响应无效，但是相关的响应仍可能存储在它没有访问的其他缓存中。

trans-unit.source: Before Firefox 58, frame-ancestors is ignored in Content-Security-Policy-Report-Only.
trans-unit.target: 在Firefox 58之前， Content-Security-Policy-Report-Only 中将忽略 frame-ancestors 。

trans-unit.source: Before Firefox 80, applying fullscreen to an <iframe> (i.e. via the allow attribute) does not work unless the allowfullscreen attribute is also present.
trans-unit.target: 在Firefox 80之前，除非还存在 allowfullscreen 属性，否则将 fullscreen 应用到 <iframe> （即通过 allow 属性）不起作用。

trans-unit.source: Before Firefox for Android 58, frame-ancestors is ignored in Content-Security-Policy-Report-Only.
trans-unit.target: 在适用于Android 58的Firefox之前， Content-Security-Policy-Report-Only 中将忽略 frame-ancestors 。

trans-unit.source: Before a client and server can exchange an HTTP request/response pair, they must establish a TCP connection, a process which requires several round-trips. The default behavior of HTTP/1.0 is to open a separate TCP connection for each HTTP request/response pair. This is less efficient than sharing a single TCP connection when multiple requests are sent in close succession.
trans-unit.target: 在客户端和服务器交换HTTP请求/响应对之前,它们必须建立一个TCP连接,这个过程需要多次往返。HTTP/1.0的默认行为是为每个HTTP请求/响应对打开一个单独的TCP连接。当连续发送多个请求时,这比共享一个TCP连接效率低。

trans-unit.source: Before later builds of Chrome 64, invalid Expect-CT reports would be sent. Newer versions do not send reports after 10 weeks from the build date. See bug 786563.
trans-unit.target: 在更高版本的Chrome 64之前，将发送无效的Expect-CT报告。从生成日期起10周后，较新的版本将不发送报告。参见错误786563。

trans-unit.source: Beginning in version 41, Firefox for Android will contain the Android version as part of the <var>platform</var> token. For increased interoperability, if the browser is running on a version below 4 it will report 4.4. Android versions 4 and above will report the version accurately. Note that the same Gecko—with the same capabilities—is shipped to all versions of Android.
trans-unit.target: 从版本41开始，适用于Android的Firefox将包含Android版本作为 <var>platform</var> 令牌的一部分。为了提高互操作性，如果浏览器运行于4以下的版本，它将报告4.4。Android 4及更高版本将准确报告该版本。请注意，相同的Gecko（具有相同的功能）已随附在所有版本的Android中。

在下面，客户端使用POST创建成员条目：POST / myblog / entries HTTP / 1.1主机：example.org授权：Basic ZGFmZnk6c2VjZXJldA == Content-Type：application / atom + xml; type = entry Content-Length：nnn Slug：第一篇文章<？xml version =“ 1.0”？> <entry xmlns =“ http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom”> <title> Atom-Powered Robots Run Amok </ title> <id> urn： uuid：1225c695-cfb8-4ebb-aaaa-80da344efa6a </ id> <updated> 2007-02-123T17：09：02Z </ updated> <author> <name>兰辛船长</ name> </ author> <content>实在令人不寒而栗...固态金属</ content> </ entry>服务器发出状态码为201的成功创建信号，并在响应中返回ETag标头。因为在这种情况下，服务器返回的Content-Location标头和Location标头具有相同的值，所以返回的Entry表示可以理解为新创建的Entry的完整表示（请参见9.2节）。 HTTP / 1.1 201创建日期：2007年2月23日星期五21:17:11 GMT内容长度：nnn内容类型：application / atom + xml; type = entry位置：http://example.org/edit/first- post.atom内容位置：http://example.org/edit/first-post.atom ETag：“ e180ee84f0671b1” <？xml version =“ 1.0”？> <entry xmlns =“ http：//www.w3。 org / 2005 / Atom“> <title>运行Atom的原子动力机器人</ title> <id> urn：uuid：1225c695-cfb8-4ebb-aaaa-80da344efa6a </ id> <已更新> 2007-02-123T17：09 ：02Z </ updated> <author> <name>兰辛船长</ name> </ author> <content>这是一件动人的事……固体金属</ content> </ entry>客户端可以根据需要使用返回的ETag值稍后构造一个[Conditional GET]，如[RFC2616]。在这种情况下，客户端在进行编辑之前，使用If-None-Match标头发送该成员的ETag值。 GET /edit/first-post.atom HTTP / 1.1主机：example.org授权：基本ZGFmZnk6c2VjZXJldA == If-None-Match：“ e180ee84f0671b1”如果未修改该条目，则响应将是状态码304（ “未修改”）。这样，客户端可以在编辑时确定其是否仍具有条目的最新表示形式。 HTTP / 1.1 304未修改日期：2007年2月24日，星期六，格林尼治标准时间（GMT）编辑后，客户端可以放入条目并在If-Match标头中发送ETag实体值，从而通知服务器接受该条目。条件是发送的实体值仍与服务器的匹配。PUT /edit/first-post.atom HTTP / 1.1主机：example.org授权：基本的ZGFmZnk6c2VjZXJldA ==内容类型：application / atom + xml; type = entry内容长度：nnn If-Match：“ e180ee84f0671b1” <？ xml version =“ 1.0”？> <entry xmlns =“ http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom”> <title>运行Atom的原子动力机器人</ title> <id> urn：uuid：1225c695- cfb8-4ebb-aaaa-80da344efa6a </ id> <updated> 2007-02-24T16：34：06Z </ updated> <author> <name> Captain Lansing </ name> </ author> <content> Update：这是一个骗局！</ content> </ entry>然而，此后服务器收到的副本比客户端的副本要新，并以状态代码412响应（“前提条件失败”）。 HTTP / 1.1 412前提条件失败日期：2007年2月24日，星期六，格林尼治标准时间（GMT），此信息通知客户端服务器具有条目的最新版本，并且将不允许存储发送的实体。

下面，客户端将包含PNG图像的POST请求发送到接受PNG图像的Collection的URI：POST / edit / HTTP / 1.1主机：media.example.org内容类型：image / png子弹：海滩授权：基本ZGFmZnk6c2VjZXJldA ==内容长度：nnn ...二进制数据服务器用状态代码201发出成功创建信号的信号。响应包括一个Location头，指示媒体链接条目的成员URI以及该条目在目录中的表示。响应的主体。媒体链接条目包括具有“ src”属性的内容元素。它还包含一个链接关系为“ edit-media”的链接，该链接指定用于修改媒体资源的IRI。 HTTP / 1.1 201创建日期：2005年10月7日星期五17:17：11 GMT内容长度：nnn内容类型：application / atom + xml; type = entry; charset =“ utf-8”位置：http://example.org/media/edit/the_beach.atom <？xml version = “ 1.0”？> <entry xmlns =“ http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom”> <title>海滩</ title> <id> ur：uuid：1225c695-cfb8-4ebb-aaaa-80da344efa6a </ id> <updated> 2005-10-07T17：17：08Z </ updated> <author> <name> Daffy </ name> </ author> <summary type =“ text” /> <content type =“ image / png“ src =” http://media.example.org/the_beach.png“ /> <link rel =” edit-media“ href =” http://media.example.org/edit/the_beach.png“ /> <链接rel =“ edit” href =“ http://example.org/media/edit/the_beach.atom” /> </ entry>稍后，客户端使用Media中指示的URI发送包含新PNG的PUT请求链接条目的“编辑媒体”链接：PUT /edit/the_beach.png HTTP / 1.1主机：media.example.org内容类型：image / png授权：基本的ZGFmZnk6c2VjZXJldA ==内容长度：nnn ...二进制数据服务器发出状态代码为200的成功编辑信号。HTTP / 1.1 200 Ok日期：2006年10月8日星期五17:17:11 GMT客户端可以编辑图片的元数据。首先获取媒体链接条目：GET /media/edit/the_beach.atom HTTP / 1.1主机：example.org授权：基本ZGFmZnk6c2VjZXJldA ==返回了媒体链接条目。 HTTP / 1.1 200 Ok日期：2005年10月7日星期五，格林尼治标准时间（GMT）内容长度：nnn内容类型：application / atom + xml; type = entry; charset =“ utf-8” ETag：“ c181bb840673b5” < ？xml version =“ 1.0”？> <entry xmlns =“ http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom”> <title>海滩</ title> <id> ur：uuid：1225c695-cfb8-4ebb -aaaa-80da344efa6a </ id> <updated> 2005-10-07T17：17：08Z </ updated> <author> <name> Daffy </ name> </ author> <summary type =“ text” /> <content type =“ image / png” src =“ http://media.example.org/the_beach.png” /> <link rel =“ edit-media”href =“ http://media.example.org/edit/the_beach.png” /> <link rel =“ edit” href =“ http://example.org/media/edit/the_beach.atom” /> < / entry>可以更新元数据，在这种情况下，可以添加摘要，然后将其放回服务器。 PUT /media/edit/the_beach.atom HTTP / 1.1主机：example.org授权：基本的ZGFmZnk6c2VjZXJldA ==内容类型：application / atom + xml; type = entry内容长度：nnn If-Match：“ c181bb840673b5” <？ xml version =“ 1.0”？> <entry xmlns =“ http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom”> <title>海滩</ title> <id> ur：uuid：1225c695-cfb8-4ebb- aaaa-80da344efa6a </ id> <已更新> 2005-10-07T17：17：08Z </ updated> <author> <name> Daffy </ name> </ author> <summary type =“ text”>一张美丽的落日照片。 </ summary> <content type =“ image / png” src =“ http://media.example.org/the_beach.png” /> <link rel =“ edit-media” href =“ http：// media。 example.org/edit/the_beach.png“ /> <link rel =” edit“ href =” http://example.org/media/edit/the_beach.atom“ /> </ entry>更新成功。 HTTP / 1.1 200确定日期：2005年10月7日星期五17:19:11 GMT内容长度：0可以将多个媒体资源添加到集合中。 POST / edit / HTTP / 1.1主机：media.example.org内容类型：图片/ png Slug：码头授权：基本ZGFmZnk6c2VjZXJldA ==内容长度：nnn ...二进制数据资源已成功创建。 HTTP / 1.1 201创建日期：2005年10月7日星期五17:17:11 GMT内容长度：nnn内容类型：application / atom + xml; type = entry; charset =“ utf-8”位置：http：// example.org/media/edit/the_pier.atom <？xml version =“ 1.0”？> <entry xmlns =“ http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom”> <title>码头</ title> <id> urn：uuid：1225c695-cfb8-4ebb-aaaa-80da344efe6b </ id> <updated> 2005-10-07T17：26：43Z </ updated> <author> <name> Daffy </ name> </ author > <summary type =“ text” /> <content type =“image / png“ src =” http://media.example.org/the_pier.png“ /> <link rel =” edit-media“ href =” http://media.example.org/edit/the_pier.png “ /> <link rel =” edit“ href =” http://example.org/media/edit/the_pier.atom“ /> </ entry>客户端现在可以在博客Entry Collection中创建一个新的Atom Entry，引用两个新创建的媒体资源POST / blog / HTTP / 1.1主机：example.org内容类型：application / atom + xml; type = entry子弹：在海滩上玩的日子授权：基本的ZGFmZnk6c2VjZXJldA ==内容长度： nnn <？xml version =“ 1.0”？> <entry xmlns =“ http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom”> <title>在海滩上度过快乐的一天</ title> <id> ur：uuid：1225c695-cfb8-4ebb-aaaa-80da344efa6b </ id> <updated> 2005-10-07T17：40：02Z </ updated> <author> <name> Daffy </ name> </ author> <content type =“ xhtml”> <xhtml：div xmlns：xhtml =“ http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml”> <xhtml：p>我们在海滩上度过了美好的一天。 <xhtml：img alt =“海滩” src =“ http://media.example.org/the_beach.png” /> </ xhtml：p> <xhtml：p>后来我们走到码头。 <xhtml：img alt =“码头” src =“ http://media.example.org/the_pier.png” /> </ xhtml：p> </ xhtml：div> </ content> </ entry>资源已成功创建。 HTTP / 1.1 200 Ok日期：2005年10月7日星期五17:20:11 GMT内容长度：nnn内容类型：application / atom + xml; type = entry; charset =“ utf-8”位置：http：// example.org/blog/atom/a-day-at-the-beach.atom <？xml version =“ 1.0”？> <entry xmlns =“ http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom”> < title>在海滩上度过快乐的一天</ title> <id> http://example.org/blog/a-day-at-the-beach.xhtml </ id> <更新> 2005-10-07T17：43 ：07Z </ updated> <author> <name> Daffy </ name> </ author> <content type =“ xhtml”> <xhtml：div xmlns：xhtml =“ http://www.w3.org/1999/ xhtml“><xhtml：p>我们在海滩上度过了美好的一天。 <xhtml：img alt =“海滩” src =“ http://media.example.org/the_beach.png” /> </ xhtml：p> <xhtml：p>后来我们走到码头。 <xhtml：img alt =“码头” src =“ http://media.example.org/the_pier.png” /> </ xhtml：p> </ xhtml：div> </ content> <link rel =“编辑“ href =” http://example.org/blog/edit/a-day-at-the-beach.atom“ /> <link rel =” alternate“ type =” text / html“ href =” http： //example.org/blog/a-day-at-the-beach.html“ /> </ entry>请注意，返回的Entry包含一个具有“ alternate”关系的链接，该链接指向已创建的关联HTML页面-这在本规范中不是必需的，但包含该链接是为了显示服务器可以对以下内容进行的更改条目。

在下面，客户端使用集合的URI发送包含Atom Entry表示形式的POST请求：POST / edit / HTTP / 1.1主机：example.org用户代理：Thingio / 1.0授权：基本ZGFmZnk6c2VjZXJldA ==内容类型：application / atom + xml; type = entry内容长度：nnn子弹：第一篇<？xml version =“ 1.0”？> <entry xmlns =“ http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom”> <title>原子动力机器人运行Amok </ title> <id> urn：uuid：1225c695-cfb8-4ebb-aaaa-80da344efa6a </ id> <updated> 2003-12-13T18：30：02Z </ updated> <author> < name> John Doe </ name> </ author> <content>一些文本。</ content> </ entry>服务器用状态代码201发出成功创建的信号。响应包括一个Location头，指示Atom条目的Member Entry URI，以及该条目在响应主体中的表示。 HTTP / 1.1 201创建日期：2005年10月7日星期五17:17:11 GMT内容长度：nnn内容类型：application / atom + xml; type = entry; charset =“ utf-8”位置：http：// example.org/edit/first-post.atom ETag：“ c180de84f991g8” <？xml version =“ 1.0”？> <entry xmlns =“ http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom”> <title> Atom动力的机器人运行Amok </ title> <id> urn：uuid：1225c695-cfb8-4ebb-aaaa-80da344efa6a </ id> <updated> 2003-12-13T18：30：02Z </ updated> <author> <name> John Doe </ name> </ author> <content>一些文本。</ content> <link rel =“ edit” href =“ http://example.org/edit/first-post.atom” /> </ entry>集合创建并返回的条目可能与客户端发布的条目不匹配。服务器可以更改条目中各个元素的值，例如atom：id，atom：updated和atom：author值，并且可以选择删除或添加其他元素和属性，或者更改元素内容和属性值。集合创建并返回的条目可能与客户端发布的条目不匹配。服务器可以更改条目中各个元素的值，例如atom：id，atom：updated和atom：author值，并且可以选择删除或添加其他元素和属性，或者更改元素内容和属性值。集合创建和返回的条目可能与客户端发布的条目不匹配。服务器可以更改条目中各个元素的值，例如atom：id，atom：updated和atom：author值，并且可以选择删除或添加其他元素和属性，或者更改元素内容和属性值。

trans-unit.source: Besides the setting of the validators on the server side, this mechanism is transparent: all browsers manage a cache and send such conditional requests without any special work to be done by Web developers.
trans-unit.target: 除了在服务器端设置验证器外,这种机制是透明的:所有的浏览器都会管理一个缓存,并发送这样的条件请求,而不需要Web开发人员做任何特殊的工作。

trans-unit.source: Best Practices for Using the Vary Header – fastly.com
trans-unit.target: 使用Vary标头的最佳做法– fast.com

trans-unit.source: Best practices for good user experiences
trans-unit.target: 良好用户体验的最佳实践

trans-unit.source: Between the Web browser and the server, numerous computers and machines relay the HTTP messages. Due to the layered structure of the Web stack, most of these operate at either the transport, network or physical levels, becoming transparent at the HTTP layer and potentially making a significant impact on performance. Those operating at the application layers are generally called proxies. These can be transparent, or not (changing requests going through them), and may perform numerous functions:
trans-unit.target: 在Web浏览器和服务器之间，许多计算机和机器中继HTTP消息。由于Web堆栈的分层结构，其中大多数都在传输，网络或物理级别上运行，在HTTP层变得透明，并可能对性能产生重大影响。在应用程序层上运行的那些通常称为代理。这些可以透明，也可以不透明（更改通过它们的请求），并且可以执行许多功能：

trans-unit.source: Between the Web browser and the server, numerous computers and machines relay the HTTP messages. Due to the layered structure of the Web stack, most of these operate at the transport, network or physical levels, becoming transparent at the HTTP layer and potentially making a significant impact on performance. Those operating at the application layers are generally called proxies. These can be transparent, forwarding on the requests they receive without altering them in any way, or non-transparent, in which case they will change the request in some way before passing it along to the server. Proxies may perform numerous functions:
trans-unit.target: 在Web浏览器和服务器之间，许多计算机和机器中继HTTP消息。由于Web堆栈的分层结构，其中大多数都在传输，网络或物理级别上运行，在HTTP层上变得透明，并可能对性能产生重大影响。在应用程序层上运行的那些通常称为代理。它们可以是透明的，可以转发接收到的请求而不进行任何更改，也可以是不透明的，在这种情况下，它们将以某种方式更改请求，然后再将其传递给服务器。代理可以执行许多功能：

trans-unit.source: Browser detection using the user agent
trans-unit.target: 使用用户代理进行浏览器检测

trans-unit.source: Browser fingerprinting is a set of techniques for identifying a specific user agent over time through its unique set of characteristics. These characteristics might include information related to its TCP behavior, feature capabilities, and scripting environment, though of particular interest here is the set of unique characteristics that might be communicated via HTTP. Fingerprinting is considered a privacy concern because it enables tracking of a user agent's behavior over time without the corresponding controls that the user might have over other forms of data collection (e.g., cookies). Many general-purpose user agents (i.e., Web browsers) have taken steps to reduce their fingerprints. There are a number of request header fields that might reveal information to servers that is sufficiently unique to enable fingerprinting. The From header field is the most obvious, though it is expected that From will only be sent when self-identification is desired by the user. Likewise, Cookie header fields are deliberately designed to enable re-identification, so fingerprinting concerns only apply to situations where cookies are disabled or restricted by the user agent's configuration. The User-Agent header field might contain enough information to uniquely identify a specific device, usually when combined with other characteristics, particularly if the user agent sends excessive details about the user's system or extensions. However, the source of unique information that is least expected by users is proactive negotiation (Section 5.3), including the Accept, Accept-Charset, Accept-Encoding, and Accept-Language header fields. In addition to the fingerprinting concern, detailed use of the Accept-Language header field can reveal information the user might consider to be of a private nature. For example, understanding a given language set might be strongly correlated to membership in a particular ethnic group. An approach that limits such loss of privacy would be for a user agent to omit the sending of Accept-Language except for sites that have been whitelisted, perhaps via interaction after detecting a Vary header field that indicates language negotiation might be useful. In environments where proxies are used to enhance privacy, user agents ought to be conservative in sending proactive negotiation header fields. General-purpose user agents that provide a high degree of header field configurability ought to inform users about the loss of privacy that might result if too much detail is provided. As an extreme privacy measure, proxies could filter the proactive negotiation header fields in relayed requests.
trans-unit.target: 浏览器指纹是通过其独特的特征集随时间识别特定用户代理的一组技术。这些特征可能包括与其TCP行为，功能和脚本环境有关的信息，尽管这里特别有趣的是可以通过HTTP进行通信的一组独特特征。指纹被认为是隐私问题，因为指纹可以随时间跟踪用户代理的行为，而无需用户对其他形式的数据收集（例如cookie）进行相应控制。许多通用用户代理（即Web浏览器）已采取措施减少指纹。有许多请求标头字段可能会向服务器揭示足够独特的信息以启用指纹识别。 “发件人”标头字段是最明显的，尽管可以预期“发件人”仅在用户需要自我识别时才发送。同样，Cookie标头字段是经过精心设计的，以启用重新标识，因此指纹关注仅适用于用户代理的配置禁用或限制Cookie的情况。通常，当与其他特征结合使用时，用户代理标头字段可能包含足够的信息来唯一标识特定设备，特别是如果用户代理发送有关用户系统或扩展的过多详细信息时。然而，用户最期待的唯一信息来源是主动协商（第5.3节），包括“接受”，“接受字符集”，“接受编码”和“接受语言”标头字段。除了指纹识别方面的问题外，Accept-Language标头字段的详细使用还可以揭示用户可能认为属于私人性质的信息。例如，了解给定的语言集可能与特定种族的成员关系密切相关。限制此类隐私丢失的一种方法是，对于用户代理，除了已列入白名单的站点之外，可以省略发送接受语言，可能是通过在检测到表示语言协商的Vary标头字段之后进行交互来实现的。在使用代理来增强隐私的环境中，用户代理在发送主动协商标头字段时应该保持保守。提供高度的标头字段可配置性的通用用户代理应该通知用户有关隐私丢失的信息，如果提供的详细信息过多，则可能会导致隐私丢失。作为一种极端的隐私措施，代理可以过滤中继请求中的主动协商标头字段。

trans-unit.source: Browsers ignore the Expect-CT header over HTTP; the header only has effect on HTTPS connections.
trans-unit.target: 浏览器会忽略HTTP上的 Expect-CT 标头；标头仅对HTTPS连接有效。

trans-unit.source: Browsers are migrating to have cookies default to SameSite=Lax. If a cookie is needed to be sent cross-origin, opt out of the SameSite restriction using the None value. The None value requires the Secure attribute.
trans-unit.target: 浏览器正在迁移，以使Cookie默认为 SameSite=Lax 。如果需要跨域发送cookie，请使用 None 值选择退出 SameSite 限制。该 None 值需要的 Secure 属性。

trans-unit.source: Browsers are migrating to have cookies default to SameSite=Lax. If a cookie is needed to be sent cross-origin, opt out of the SameSite restriction by using the None directive. The None directive requires that the Secure attribute also be used.
trans-unit.target: 浏览器正在迁移，以使Cookie默认为 SameSite=Lax 。如果需要跨域发送cookie，请使用 None 指令选择退出SameSite限制。在 None 指令要求的 Secure 属性也可以使用。

trans-unit.source: Browsers block frontend JavaScript code from accessing the Set Cookie header, as required by the Fetch spec, which defines Set-Cookie as a forbidden response-header name that must be filtered out from any response exposed to frontend code.
trans-unit.target: 浏览器按照Fetch规范的要求阻止前端JavaScript代码访问 Set Cookie 标头，该规范将 Set-Cookie 定义为禁止的响应标头名称，该名称必须从暴露给前端代码的任何响应中过滤掉。

trans-unit.source: Browsers send specific HTTP headers for cross-site requests initiated from within XMLHttpRequest or the Fetch API. It also expects to see specific HTTP headers sent back with cross-site responses. An overview of these headers, including sample JavaScript code that initiates requests and processes responses from the server, as well as a discussion of each header, can be found in the HTTP Access Control (CORS) article and should be read as a companion article to this one. This article covers processing Access Control Requests and formulating Access Control Responses in PHP. The target audience for this article are server programmers or administrators. Although the code samples shown here are in PHP, similar concepts apply for ASP.net, Perl, Python, Java, etc.; in general, these concepts can be applied to any server-side programming environment that processes HTTP requests and dynamically formulates HTTP responses.
trans-unit.target: 浏览器为从 XMLHttpRequest 或Fetch API中发起的跨站点请求发送特定的HTTP标头。它还期望看到特定的HTTP标头与跨站点响应一起发回。可以在HTTP访问控制（CORS）文章中找到这些标头的概述，包括启动请求和处理来自服务器的响应的示例JavaScript代码以及每个标头的讨论，这些标头应作为与之配套的文章阅读。这个。本文介绍如何处理访问控制请求和制定访问控制响应在PHP中。本文的目标读者是服务器程序员或管理员。尽管此处显示的代码示例是使用PHP编写的，但类似的概念也适用于ASP.net，Perl，Python，Java等。通常，这些概念可以应用于处理HTTP请求并动态制定HTTP响应的任何服务器端编程环境。

trans-unit.source: Browsers use utf-8 encoding for usernames and passwords.
trans-unit.target: 浏览器对用户名和密码使用 utf-8 编码。

trans-unit.source: Browsers use utf-8 encoding for usernames and passwords. Firefox used to use ISO-8859-1, but changed over to utf-8 for parity with other browsers, and to avoid potential problems as described in bug 1419658.
trans-unit.target: 浏览器对用户名和密码使用 utf-8 编码。Firefox曾经使用 ISO-8859-1 ，但为了与其他浏览器保持同等地位而更改为 utf-8 ，以避免潜在的问题，如bug 1419658中所述。

trans-unit.source: Browsers use the MIME type, not the file extension, to determine how to process a URL — it is important that servers send the correct MIME type in the response's Content-Type header.
trans-unit.target: 浏览器使用MIME类型而不是文件扩展名来确定如何处理URL-服务器在响应的Content-Type标头中发送正确的MIME类型非常重要。

trans-unit.source: Browsers will not remember an Expect-CT policy, unless the site has 'proven' it can serve a certificate satisfying the certificate transparency requirements. Browsers implement their own trust model regarding which CT logs are considered trusted for the certificate to have been logged to.
trans-unit.target: 浏览器将不会记住 Expect-CT 策略，除非站点已“证明”它可以提供满足证书透明性要求的证书。浏览器实现他们自己的信任模型，关于该信任模型，哪些CT日志被视为对已登录证书的信任。

trans-unit.source: Buggy proxies are still common and these lead to strange and erratic behaviors that Web developers cannot foresee and diagnose easily.
trans-unit.target: 错误的代理仍然很常见，并且会导致Web开发人员无法轻易预见和诊断的奇怪和不稳定的行为。

trans-unit.target: Chrome版本的设计旨在在安装日期的10周后停止执行 Expect-CT 政策。

trans-unit.source: But browsers and standards are not perfect, and there are still some edge cases where detecting the browser is needed. Using the user agent to detect the browser looks simple, but doing it well is, in fact, a very hard problem. This document will guide you in doing this as correctly as possible.
trans-unit.target: 但浏览器和标准并不完美,在一些边缘情况下,还是需要检测浏览器。使用用户代理来检测浏览器看起来很简单,但实际上,做好这个工作是一个非常困难的问题。本文档将指导你尽可能正确地做这件事。
